hints.content:
The train started with $90$ passengers and then $52$ got off in Tokyo.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2169b2fae1688a329a354fb3dbcbcc6ecac5162b)

$\purpleD{90}-\blueE{52}=\maroonD{38}$

The train had $\maroonD{38}$ passengers left after they left Tokyo.

Then, another $\tealE{29}$ passengers got off at Kobe.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3def42dccc4b72c0fcd0c005052f1b52a5426c8b)

$\maroonD{38}-\tealE{29}=\goldE{9}$
The train had $\goldE{9}$ passengers still on the train.

question.content:
A train traveling through Japan has $90$ passengers.   

$52$ passengers get off in Tokyo.  In Kobe, another $29$ passengers get off the train.  No new passengers get on the train.

**How many passengers are still on the train?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] passengers
